articles.title: 'We have never seen such a disaster': Dozens dead after heavy flooding in Europe - Stuff.co.nz
articles.description: Heavy flooding in Germany and Belgium turned streams and streets into deadly torrents that swept cars away and caused houses to collapse.
articles.content:
Dozens of people have died and many more are missing in Germany and Belgium, after heavy flooding turned streams and streets into raging torrents that swept away cars and caused houses to collapse.

articles.title: At least 6 killed in Germany as flooding caused by rainfall 'not seen in 100 years' hits Europe - CNN Philippines
articles.description: At least 46 people have died due to severe flooding in western Europe, caused by what experts described as the heaviest rainfall in a century.
articles.content:

articles.author: Nadine Schmidt and Schams Elwazer, CNN
articles.title: At least 6 killed in Germany as flooding caused by rainfall 'not seen in 100 years' hits Europe - CNN
articles.description: Torrential rain has caused severe floods in several western European countries, including Germany -- where at least six people have died -- as well as in Belgium, Luxembourg and the Netherlands.
